remarks: Left identity for the principal Dirichlet character.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Apr-2016.)
statement:
dchrmhm.g $e |- G = ( DChr ` N ) $.
dchrmhm.z $e |- Z = ( Z/nZ ` N ) $.
dchrmhm.b $e |- D = ( Base ` G ) $.
dchrn0.b $e |- B = ( Base ` Z ) $.
dchrn0.u $e |- U = ( Unit ` Z ) $.
dchr1cl.o $e |- .1. = ( k e. B |-> if ( k e. U , 1 , 0 ) ) $.
dchrmulid2.t $e |- .x. = ( +g ` G ) $.
dchrmulid2.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. D ) $.
dchrmulid2 $p |- ( ph -> ( .1. .x. X ) = X ) $.
$d B k $.
$d N k $.

$d X k $.
